fields.description:
{code}
 $ hg clone https://bitbucket.org/pypy/pypy

 destination directory: pypy
 applying clone bundle from https://api.media.atlassian.com/file/ade8a479-34db-4526-9823-6bd33d7703fa/binary?client=b64ca8e6-e703-4cb9-8f30-cae44f70ea24&token=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJhY2Nlc3MiOnsidXJuOmZpbGVzdG9yZTpmaWxlOmFkZThhNDc5LTM0ZGItNDUyNi05ODIzLTZiZDMzZDc3MDNmYSI6WyJyZWFkIl19LCJleHAiOjE1NDY3Nzg3NDAsImlzcyI6ImI2NGNhOGU2LWU3MDMtNGNiOS04ZjMwLWNhZTQ0ZjcwZWEyNCIsIm5iZiI6MTU0Njc3ODMyMH0.DyHo3Ft-mk_ixHgL1Q6LXGJ1grzALRLarTtXJKD91rk
 error fetching bundle: [SSL: SSLV3_ALERT_HANDSHAKE_FAILURE] sslv3 alert handshake failure (_ssl.c:727)
 abort: error applying bundle
{code}

This is [Debian Bug BCLOUD-918475|https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi%3Fbug%3D918475].

It seems that if the rsa_pkcs1_sha1 signature algorithm is not present in the client hello, the server rejects the connection, even though this algorithm is never used.
fields.summary: bitbucket servers require rsa_pkcs1_sha1 even for tlsv1.2 connections

fields.description:
When a pull request is created for an issues containing several commits, the pull request is labelled with the branch number and contains a list of the commit messages. However, when a pull request contains just one commit, the pull request doesn't contain any such identifying information.

My proposed enhancement is to label single commit pull requests with the branch number; it would also be helpful for the commit message to be listed.
fields.summary: Include branch number in pull requests containing a single commit

fields.description:
We have a project where the Bitbucket pipelines are randomly failing with an error similar to this:

{{> java.io.IOException: Cannot run program "hg" (in directory "/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/webservice"): error=2, No such file or directory}}\\
By random I mean non-deterministically, that is the same changeset might fail or might succeed. Nobody knows. Running the same gradle localluy or on our jenkins build server always works, only Bitbucket pipelines seem to fail arbitrarily.
fields.summary: Bitbucket pipelines are randomly failing.

fields.description:
As mentioned in the [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/bitbucket-api-changes-gdpr/|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/bitbucket/bitbucket-api-changes-gdpr], the {{username}} field has been replaced by the {{account_id}} field.

It can be tricky to look up user accounts as a result of this, especially from the perspective of a team admin who needs to manage all users within the team/organization across accounts.

It would be great if users are given the choice on whether to adhere or to opt out of the new changes via a toggleable configuration.
fields.summary: Allow users to opt out of the GDPR changes to username

fields.description:
When you have a repository configured with Landing Page with "Pull Request" followed by  clicking on the repository directly from the Repository Dashboard(https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/repositories), the page will load indefinitely. Console generates the error as below.

{code}
TypeError: Cannot read property 'full_name' of null

----

The above error occurred in task Sp
    created by Sp
    created by Sp
Tasks cancelled due to error:
takeLatest(global/SCROLL_TO, bd)

{code}

Opening the same repository from the dashboard to a new tab, loads with no issues.

*Workaround*

* Open the repository in a new tab
fields.summary: Opening a Repository from Bitbucket Dashboard throws error when landing page is set with Pull Request

fields.description: !3125793701-image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Teams page is blank
Site not shown correctly

fields.description:
If someone changes their workspace ID and someone else attempts to create an account with that same ID, an error code is thrown instead of saying that the ID is unavailable.

This does not happen when a username is a duplicate, for usernames Bitbucket says that there is already an account with that name
fields.summary: Duplicate workspace ID handling

fields.description:
When calling this API from the user interface: [https://bitbucket.org/knowarebe/account/admin/logo|https://bitbucket.org/knowarebe/account/admin/logo]

The server returns HTTP 500.

The logo used has already been used many times in the past in other repository so it cannot be the issue. I attach the logo to be sure.

The code of the error message: 6695abcbc78343d28f150eab069c22a5
fields.summary: HTTP 500 when uploading a new logo in a BitBucket repository newly created

fields.description:
This will error in the pipelines with:

{code}
There is an error in your bitbucket-pipelines.yml at [pipelines > tags > v*.*.*-*.* > 1 > step > script > 1]. To be precise: Missing or empty command string. Each item in this list should either be a single command string or a map defining a pipe invocation.
{code}

{code}
'v*.*.*-*.*':
  - step: *build
  - step:
      name: Version Tag
      script:
        - echo "package version: $BITBUCKET_TAG"
{code}

‌

This will not error and runs successfully (notice the removed “:” after “version”):

{code}
'v*.*.*-*.*':
  - step: *build
  - step:
      name: Version Tag
      script:
        - echo "package version $BITBUCKET_TAG"
{code}
fields.summary: Pipelines step > script syntax error

fields.description:
In cases where an error occurs, it will usually throw a “Something went wrong” page that contains an error code.

It’ll be great if users can directly review what is causing the error and make the appropriate steps rather than taking additional time to contact support just so they can review what is causing the error in the first place.
fields.summary: Please provide more detailed stack traces for errors rather than giving a generic "Something went wrong" page with an error code.

fields.description: Hello, it is not possible to save changes in the project settings screen. When saving, the following error code is generated: *5a103553dac6407780abdc5273f8605d*
fields.summary: Error on edit Project settings

fields.description:
I want to export Issue Data . But System show Error Message like this:

The error was: *Error exporting attachment: 圖3.png: unicode argument expected, got 'str'*

please provide us with this key: 0be32c53-5b26-4e37-9321-62c615970ce2. It will help us diagnose the problem.
fields.summary: Cannot export Issue

fields.description:
The new Bitbucket/Slack integration has a very rich feature set. Some of those features require privileges sufficient to make changes to the repository.

The features we want to actually use are much more restricted: essentially we just want to get notices in Slack when commits are made or Pull Requests sent; we emphatically don't want Slack to be able to make any changes at all.

What we'd like is either a way to grant the integration only read-only access to the repository regardless of the person configuring it.
fields.summary: Slack Integration with Read-only mode.

fields.description: Bitbucket says ‘There are no changes. No commits on <x> that aren't on <y>.’ for any branch x and y
fields.summary: Cannot create PR

fields.description:
What did I do:

# Navigate to any branch that is behind master
# Click ‘Sync now’ button before the page finishes loading (click it asap)
# Nothing happens
# Click again after page finishes loading
# The sync modal appears

!1156305050-1.PNG|thumbnail!\\
!82036615-2.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: 'Sync now' button does nothing if clicked before page load completes

fields.description:
I was listed as a reviewer on a pull request, and accepted the PR.

Later, I wanted to remove myself as a reviewer. I edited the PR and deleted myself from the reviewers, but when I saved the changes, I still appeared as a reviewer. I did this multiple times to no avail, until I tried cancelling my accept of the PR. I disappeared as a reviewer immediately, even without removing myself again.

It looks like someone who has accepted the PR but is no longer a reviewer still appears as a reviewer, even in the “edit PR” view. This is very confusing.
fields.summary: Removing a reviewer who has accepted a PR

fields.description:
Hello\\
We have problems with artifacts in a pipeline. We use cypress test integration. After tests execution cypress should generate screenshot and videos in /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/cypress/screenshots/ and /opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build/cypress/videos/.

Looking at the real-time logs, the pipeline proceeds until the artifacts upload step is reached, and then hangs there.

Unfortunately the pipeline execution failed with error: "Exceeded build time limit of 120 minutes."

There are a limit of number of size artifacts? I know artifact are canceled after a week. Right?

Please support us urgently.\\
Thank you
fields.summary: Artifacts not generated in a pipeline
Error calling AWS CodeDeploy URL to install Add-on

fields.description:
Dear support team, i have a problem to send invitation to users on my repository, i put user alias for email, and cannot find then

please help me
fields.summary: Email invitation failure

fields.description:
Previously there was a pretty annoying bug with the alignment of hunks in PR’s.  I think we may have found another case of it happening here [https://bitbucket.org/pidgin/main/pull-requests/486#Lpidgin/gtkaccount.cF534T546|https://bitbucket.org/pidgin/main/pull-requests/486#Lpidgin/gtkaccount.cF534T546].  I’m seeing it on firefox 60 and chrome 74 on linux.

I’ve checked the raw version in the PR author’s fork and it appears to be correct there (2 tabs) but as you can see in the attached screen shot it’s offset weird from everything else that should be at the same indentation level.  I’ve already noted a few cases in the above pr assuming that this bug was fixed, but apparently this case was missed.
fields.summary: Additional whitespace issue in new pr interface

fields.description:
Member does not receive invitation mail and we cannot resend or delete invitation.

Member does not receive invitation e-mail and when the responsible tries to resend or delete the invitation (to try again)

he gets a 400 error
fields.summary: Cannot add/invite member to a team

fields.description: When I sent the invite by mail the new member is not receiving it. If I reload the members page the invite desapears.
fields.summary: unable to invite new members to repository

fields.description:
Not sure if this is a bug or intended feature, but at some point in the past couple months, a change was made so that whenever an Issue is edited, the issue’s entire content is reposted as a new comment. When making frequent changes or adjustments to an issue, the entire Issue does not (for our group) need to be reposted as a comment with the new changes; it causes a ton of useless bloat in the comments section, and it’s a pain to have to go through and delete them one by one for the sake of increasing readability.

Please add an option to disable this, probably in the Setting-Issues section.
fields.summary: Please add option to disable auto-posting the entire issue-with-changes as a comment when changes are made.

fields.description: Bitbucket webhook no more triggering Jenkins job. Earlier it was working well. Is there any change made from Bitbucket end?
fields.summary: Webhook do not trigger Jenkins job on commit

fields.description: Bitbucket webhook no more triggering Jenkins job. Earlier it was working well. Is there any change made from Bitbucket end?
fields.summary: Webhook do not trigger Jenkins job on commit

fields.description:
Bitbucket keeps crashing, and when it does, the whole page, or parts of the page, turns blank.

The issue seams to be related to the Local Storage. This has been happening for the last week or so, and my solution has been to open the developer tools, deleting the local storage, and then reload the web page.This temporarily fixes the issue, but sooner or later it happens again.

This is the error I see in the browser console:

{code}
TypeError: "this.storage is undefined"
    get store-engine.js:22
    Fe utils.ts:209
    value fetch-apps.ts:33
    React 7
    e index.js:205
    _loadModule index.js:215
    a es6.promise.js:75
    F es6.promise.js:92
    s _microtask.js:18
    nrWrapper (index):17
console.js:35
    e console.js:35
    React 11
    e index.js:205
    _loadModule index.js:215
    a es6.promise.js:75
    F es6.promise.js:92
    s _microtask.js:18
    nrWrapper 
{code}

Browser version: Firefox developer edition 68.0b5 (64-bit)\\
Operating system: Ubuntu 18.10
fields.summary: Bitbucket sporadically crashes and leaves an empty page

fields.description:
To reproduce issue, do the following:

1. Copy the following Markdown code:

{code}
> > This line will not appear when pasted

> This line WILL appear

So will this line
{code}

2. Open the dialog to create a new comment on an existing issue, or create new issue.

3. In the editor box, paste the code you copied, noting that the first line (starting with ‘> >’) does not appear.

Operating systems:

* Windows 7 Enterprise
* Windows 10 Enterprise

Browsers:

* Firefox 67.0 (Quantum)
* Firefox 60.7.0 (ESR)
* Chrome 64.0.3282.167
* Chrome 73.0.3683.103

I don’t strictly expect nested blockquotes to render as nested blocks (a leading literal ‘>’ within the block would be just fine) however, it’s a gotcha when pasting markdown from a separate editor that it will (partially) fail silently, and leave parts out of the paste, as these could fairly easily go unnoticed.
fields.summary: WYSIWYG Markdown editor - nested blockquotes cannot be pasted

fields.description:
Hello\\
We have problems with webhooks to do automatic deployments with our jenkins tool of continuous integration, it does not receive the deployments.

Please support us urgently.\\
Thank you
fields.summary: webhooks problems

fields.description:
Hi!

We are using testContainers to perform integration tests. Unfortunately, we are not being able to execute it using the bitbucket-pipeline.

We are using version 1.11.3 of testContainer to test our software with Cassandra. We are also using junt-jupiter for this.

Locally the tests are performed with any problem. We are disabling ryuk by setting TESTCONTAINERS_RYUK_DISABLED to true in the environment variables.

From the test report there seems to be a problem at the container startup:

{code}
Caused by: org.testcontainers.containers.ContainerLaunchException: Container startup failed
{code}

Since Cassandra is a huge memory consumer, I double the size for the gradle test step and give 6gb of memory to docker service.

Any idea on how to solve this problem?

Thanks in advance.\\
André
fields.summary: TestContainers + Bitbucket pipelines not working

fields.description:
Hi!

We are using bitbucket-pipeline to perform some integration tests. These tests are requested from a container image so on bitbucket-pipeline we are only execution `docker run <image>` to perform these tests. The problem is that the pipeline is not showing the tests tab.

I understood that the test reports are not present in the “host” machine so it will not find the XML reports generated by gradle and, without tests report failing it does not show the tab.

My question is: Is it possible to share a folder between the “host” and the container to send the reports? I tried with `--mout` and `-v` flags in the docker run command but without success.

If shared folder is not possible what do you guys think that could work for this issue?

Thanks in advance!

André
fields.summary: Bitbucket-pipeline: Not showing Tests tab when running tests from container

fields.description: At this moment, only failed Pipelines builds trigger notifications. It would be good to have an option to have notifications for successful Pipelines builds too.
fields.summary: Add notifications for successful Pipelines builds

fields.description:
I tried to add a user in a group:

!2758350650-s1.png|thumbnail!\\
‌

I typed his email and I press add, then nothing happen

‌

Into the inspect element I see the follow:

!159280900-s2.png|thumbnail!\\

fields.description:
This is cross-posted here from https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/11/BBS-106694 based on feedback there.

----
This may be an "as expected" race condition, but is still annoying/distracting. The rough steps to reproduce are:

# Have a default pipelines configuration that catches all branches.
# Have a PR on some branch X that triggers this default pipeline.
# Push some final changes to branch X. This triggers a pipeline execution (as expected).
# Before the pipeline in step 3 actually starts, merge the PR with "delete branch X" selected. This is the race condition.
# Note that the pipeline in step 3 errors out with something like "fatal: Remote branch X not found in upstream origin"

Possible resolutions:

# Cancel any pipelines running on branch X when branch X is deleted. This would still probably have a race condition if the cancel doesn't happen before the error is triggered.
# Don't let users merge and delete branch X while there are pipelines for branch X still running / scheduled.
# Queue the merge to happen later after all the pending pipelines have (successfully?) completed.
fields.summary: Pipelines triggers even when branch deleted

fields.description:
From the the {{commits}} section in the docs for push:payload:

bq. If someone created the reference recently, it could have commits that have been pushed to the repository, but they have not been pushed to this specific reference. If that is the case, the array includes these previously pushed commits as well.


Any way to distinguish between commits made to this ref and ones that were made before it was created?
fields.summary: A way to identify only new commits in push webhook payload

fields.description:
h1. Summary
By default, if you go to commits history and click “Next”, you will get a page with "No commits match" message.

h1. Steps to reproduce
Note: it works for any repo:

# Navigate to: [https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-http/commits/|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-http/commits/]
# Click "Next"
# The page is empty (it says "No commits match")
# Refresh the page, and commits will appear on the page. Also, you can click "next" and "prev", everything will work.

If you open a new page, you can reproduce this problem again
fields.summary: "Next" button does not work well in the commit history

fields.description:
_*Description*_

Currently, the [mirror |https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/smart-mirroring-for-bitbucket-cloud-838427434.html]delegates the authentication to Bitbucket Cloud, which in turn replies back saying that the key was not recognised on the upstream, even thought the access key was added to the repository.

That happens because the access keys will only work directly with the repo hosted on the Cloud, as the settings of the repo are not replicated - only the repo actual content,  so we are not able to verify access key that is not linked to the actual user as the Regular Access key for authentication.

In this case, would be good if we could use the same Access Key to authenticate on the Cloud through the Mirror repo.

_*Workaround*_

Create a Bitbucket User (regular account), generate the SSH key and upload it to your CI tool to be able to communicate with the mirror.
fields.summary: BitBucket Smart Mirror unable to verify repo Access Key in Bitbucket Cloud side. - Customer's Behalf

fields.description:
Hello, I just asked this question on Community Discussion.

We are running a project that has a core app, a landing page and a back-end all in the same repository. The project has 3 different parallel steps that runs for each of the parts ie. main app, landing page or back-end.

At the moment all 3 are triggered and there is a check that stops the repository if there are no changes in the respective folder.

There are 2 problems with this setup 1) Each parallel step waste about 30 seconds of build time for no reason and most importantly 2) The return status should be "Pipeline Succeeded" but the checks make the whole pipeline to fail

Ideally I'd want run the folder update checks once in the main step and start the parallel steps only if there are changes.

‌

!475814485-Capture2.JPG|thumbnail!\\
!2371962785-Capture1.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Start a parallel step if a condition is met

fields.description:
As of now, the deployments permissions only restrict on a branch level. Custom pipelines cannot be restricted and this is a big drawback. In the image, it might be much more useful to have “**Pipelines allowed to deploy to Production:*“ rather than “*Branches allowed to deploy to Production:**“

Though this was probably made by design since there is a branch permission feature in bitbucket, i would be very nice to have a way to restrict custom pipelines.

This relates to [BCLOUD-13737|BCLOUD-13737]

and [BCLOUD-15362|BCLOUD-15362]
fields.summary: Deployment permissions for custom pipelines

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, the Premium plan on a team/account allows admins to prevent people who are not admins from deploying.\\
However, there are users who would like to specify which users and/or user groups can run deployments.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option for admins to define which users/user groups can run deployment builds.
fields.summary: Restrict deployment permissions to users / groups of users

fields.description:

It covers the contents of the commit page, because it is fixed. So I can’t see commit messages, and often the first diffs.

fields.description:
h2. Scenario
A Bitbucket Team or Account has multiple repositories (sometimes dozens) that have dependencies on other repositories under the same Team/Account and needs to pull other repositories during the pipelines steps.

h2. Current Solution
In order for *repo-a* to pull *repo-b* that is under the same Team/Account, an admin must manually go into *repo-a* and copy the public key then go into *repo-b* and add that public sshkey as an “Access Key”.

h3. Proposed Enhancement
All repos under a Team/Account should have an option to automatically manage this process of sshkey/access key to sibling repos. The manual process of going through (potentially dozens) of repos to add access keys to accomplish this process is tedious and requires more overhead then necessary and should be automated or configurable in the Repo or Team/Account configs.
fields.summary: Automatically add ssh keys for all repos under account

fields.description: When creating a pull request from a Jira ticket branches dialog, the expected branch is not always selected. For example, if I try to create a PR for branch AR-123 from the Jira branches dialog, the PR creation page in Bitbucket shows has some other branch pre-selected. The expectation is that If I am creating PR for branch AR-123 then this is the branch that should be selected. It used to work like this 100% of the time until recently.
fields.summary: Wrong branch selected when creating a pull request from JIRA

fields.description:
Request to provide page indexing for the downloads section for the repositories. We have users with more than 3000+ files and in such cases the page render time is quite high. This causes the page to timeout and not display anything but a blank screen.

Thus, benchmarking the ideal number of files per page and then indexing them into pages. Also integrating page navigation would be a very welcomed addition and will ease customer experience.
fields.summary: Provide Page indexing for Downloads

fields.description:
Currently one must go back to the main list in order to view the next item → there should be a quick Left/Right arrow access to the Next/Previous item in the list.

Also, this is an annoying thing even here - hitting Tab from the Title of this exact Issue Report doesn’t take you to the Description field as it should → it instead moves focus to the formatting icons (and then the next (Bold)… and the next (Italic) ). Do you guys use this tool?
fields.summary: Issues list - Need next/last arrow to quickly browse the list
Markdown should support backslash hard-breaks

fields.description:
I’ve run into the case a few times that someone tags me in a comment on a pull request, regarding a specific issue, but I am not reviewing the pull request, and other than that comment thread, the pull request is not relevant to me.

I want to continue the conversation about the specific issue, and get notifications when someone replies to my comments, but I don’t want to get notifications on the entire pull request.

Currently my options are all or nothing: either I “unwatch” the pull request and don’t get notified when someone responds to my response, or I suck it up and deal with all of the superfluous notifications on the pull request.

I would like the ability to “watch” a specific comment thread.
fields.summary: ability to "watch" only a specific thread in a pull request

fields.description: seems like the same issue as at the incident a few days ago ([https://bitbucket.status.atlassian.com/incidents/3y65q52321z3|https://bitbucket.status.atlassian.com/incidents/3y65q52321z3])
fields.summary: stays in "starting agent" for a long time / hanging

fields.description:
Commits on Bitbucket account can be integrated with Issues under Issue tracker by adding {{#[issue_number]}}in the commit message. This functionality works fine if {{#[issue_number]}} doesn’t start the commit message, as shown below:

!3584519316-Screen%20Shot%202019-05-28%20at%201.16.45%20PM.png|thumbnail!\\
However, the functionality breaks when {{#[issue_number]}} starts the commit message and results in making the commit message a *Header* itself, shown below

!1876831495-Screen%20Shot%202019-05-28%20at%201.17.38%20PM.png|thumbnail!\\
*Workaround*:\\
Disable the beta feature “Commit list as a single page app” under the Bitbucket settings > Labs

h3. Also affect any # in the commit
fields.summary: Prefixing `#` to commit message makes it a Header

* Insights for build time of each repositories, so we will know which repo consume most Bitbucket build time

Thanks

fields.description:
Allow users to specify or override the displayed build number so it can be more useful (like an actual version number)

Instead of just showing the build counter, which is pretty meaningless, it would be nice to see the version number built or some other meaningful identifier on the Pipelines page.
fields.summary: Allow users to specify or override the displayed build number so it can be more useful (like an actual version number)
Cannot delete deploy keys using the version 2 API.

fields.description:
When a user is inactivated they are eventually re-aliased to “Unknown user #####“.

All PR’s that they merged (perhaps had any activity in) suddenly have their last activity date updated (in PR list view). Actually inspecting the PR still shows the “proper“ last activity (if PR was merged 2 weeks ago, most recent entry in PR’s activity tab is the merge event from 2 weeks ago).

But in the list of PRs view (e.g. [https://bitbucket.org/…/pull-requests/?state=MERGED|https://bitbucket.org/%E2%80%A6/pull-requests/%3Fstate%3DMERGED]) things merged weeks ago suddenly have last activity dates of today (presumably the time the user was re-alised to “Unknown user #####“). This erroneously changes the ordering in the list view, without an actual activity logged to indicate why.
fields.summary: Inactivated users re-aliased to “Unknown user #####“ changes last activity date on already merged PRs

fields.description: I have ADHD and aphantasia; keeping track of those branch threads is a bit much going through “prev” and “next.” Give me the option to see 100 commits at a time, or all commits on the same page?
fields.summary: View more and/or view all code commits in BitBucket Cloud

fields.description:
In the context of the recently implemented parametrized pipeline builds: [BCLOUD-13737|BCLOUD-13737]

There is no way to populate the inputs with default values. Repository and Account level variables are override and values always default to ““ (as stated in [Custom Vars Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/variables-in-pipelines-794502608.html#Variablesinpipelines-customvars]).

One simple and elegant way to achieve this could be to allow default values to be configured at bitbucket-pipelines.yml:

{code}
pipelines:
  custom:
    custom-build:
      - variables:
          - name: BUILD_TYPE
            default: debug
          - name: SECURE_DOMAIN
            default: somedomain.com
      - step: 
          script:
            - echo "$BUILD_TYPE build for $SECURE_DOMAIN"
{code}

I hope it makes sense. It will be very useful for us in order to avoid mistakes and failed builds, but keeping the flexibility of the project.
fields.summary: Support default values for custom pipeline variables

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Make sure you are not logged in on bitbucket.org
# Navigate to a particular project and to its issue tracker, for example: [https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg/issues|https://bitbucket.org/tortoisehg/thg/issues]
# Log in by clicking on the user icon on the bottom-left of the screen, on the “log in” item in the submenu that shows up, and selecting “log in with google”

‌

Expected result:

After you have successfully logged in with Google, you should be redirected to wherever the f**k you were when you clicked “log in”.

‌

Observed result:

You are instead redirected to the “your work” page. I hate when that happens. Not redirecting a user after login to where he was before login, is one of the most irritating UX flaws. I hate it when it happens.
fields.summary: Not redirected to where I was after login

fields.description:
Request to include all merge strategies used for bitbucket server and allow them onto cloud. At the moment the Merge strategies on cloud are very limited and are posing as one of the impediments for users to switch onto cloud.

This being a git functionality can be performed locally and then pushed to the remote. But, users demand the same degree of merge strategies to be made available on the cloud UI as was in Server.

*Available Merge strategies for Server:* https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucketserver/pull-request-merge-strategies-844499235.html

*Available Merge strategies for Cloud*\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/merge-a-pull-request-945541513.html
fields.summary: Allow all merge strategies currently on Bitbucket Server onto Cloud

fields.description: I have added 3 users to the private repository but only 2 users (out of these 3) have received mail notification. I have validated that the mail id of the third one was entered correctly and that is an valid email id. Help me how I can resolve this bug as it is hampering the third user to access the repository.
fields.summary: Unable to send mail notification to the user for private repository access

fields.description:
We have 2 living branches:

* development: marked as main development branch
* release: marked as  production branch

The latter is not in the list of “active branches”. It gets merged into development regularly and perhaps hidden because of that, but it’s never deleted nor should it be and it should remain marked as “active”.
fields.summary: Production branch hidden from active branches

I’ve created a new repo. I’ve enabled Bitbucket Pipelines but it doesn’t seem to execute when I check code in…

[https://bitbucket.org/finproducts/e2c-deploy-elastic-beanstalk/addon/pipelines/home|https://bitbucket.org/finproducts/e2c-deploy-elastic-beanstalk/addon/pipelines/home]

Have I misconfigured something or is the service down?

fields.description: The notifications at the lower left of the PR overview page notify when connection is lost or when connection is re-established, or when a pull request has been updated and the view could be updated. The notifications push each other down, causing notification boxes to be pushed out of the viewport, and their overflow if cut off. See attachments.
fields.summary: Connection notifications get pushed down

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the account owns 2 repositories with the same name, the only difference is with extension  ".git" Bitbucket  UI will redirect to the repositories that don't have .git in the name (naming  example "test" vs "test.git")

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 repositories named `test` and `test.git`
# Click test.git from the UI
# The link will redirect from test.git to test
# Delete test repositories
# clicking the test.git will redirect to test.git repositories

h3. Expected Results
Each repositories name should be unique with or without .git

h3. Actual Results
Redirection is not working properly

h3. Workaround
Appending another `.git` at the end of the URL will redirect the user to the proper repository, such as:
* https://bitbucket.org/<username>/test.git.git/admin
fields.summary: Repositories name with .git and without will redirect the user to without .git repositories name when clicked on the UI

fields.description: Miyyyrrtrtryyyyyyyyya
fields.summary: Prueba
Prueba

fields.description:
While attempting to schedule a weekly Pipelines to run on Sunday for example, Pipelines will schedule your build for Saturday for some reason.\\
This happens for every day of the week too; Say for example if you schedule a build for Tuesday, it will display as if it was scheduled to Monday.

See the screenshots attached for further details:

!4216619510-Screen%20Shot%202019-05-23%20at%2017.37.24.png|thumbnail!

!1677875736-Screen%20Shot%202019-05-23%20at%2017.37.31.png|thumbnail!

The pictures above show that my Pipelines is scheduled for Saturday, where I actually selected it to run on Sunday. The time is correct, but the day is incorrect.
fields.summary: Scheduled Pipelines time for "Weekly" option displays the incorrect build time

fields.description:
In situations that involve a huge number of repositories and users, it can be a big hassle to customize and keep track of the repository access by constantly changing them for the sake of allowing users to review the pull requests.

We should be able to configure a “Pull Request Reviewer” role where users who are added to this role can directly view all pull requests within the account.

Another alternative would be the functionality to configure the pull requests so that it can be viewed and merged by particular users without granting the repository access to them.
fields.summary: Allow users to configure a "Pull Request Reviewer" role on the account level.

fields.description:
See attached video.

In it I create a new schedule to run on Thursdays at 11am but after creating the schedule the modal that displays all the existing schedules show it is set for Wednesday.
fields.summary: Wrong day is displayed in schedule

fields.description:
I work with several small projects.\\
In one of the teams I work with a person whom I would like to add to another team.\\
I see his name, I don’t see his user-name nor email any more.\\
User Interface doesn’t allow me to add him by his name.

How I can add him?
fields.summary: Cannot find team mate to add him to another team

fields.description: During SSH Keyscan done by Pipelines, we would like to have a functionality to select Key types (RSA etc...) to be added into pipelines as, currently, it picks whichever comes first and, since the list is randomly generated, it is hard to get, for example, the same fingerprints for the IP and the DNS of the same server.
fields.summary: Ability to select key types to be added into pipelines (BBS-107092)

fields.description:
h3. Description
When a user performs an action on one of the repositories we are watching, we should receive an email notifying us about this action. However, when a user has the 'New pull request experience' enabled he will not receive these notifications, even after making sure that notifications are enabled.

h3. Expected result
All the users that are watching the repository would receive a notification.

h3. Current result
The users that have the 'New pull request experience' enabled will not receive this notification, while the other users will.

h3. Workaround
Temporarily disable the 'New pull request experience'.
fields.summary: 'New pull request experience' prevents notifications from being received

fields.description:
We have users reporting insufficient number of build environments made available on Bitbucket Cloud.

* There is also no clear documentation explaining the limits to end users. This doesn't allow them to plan ahead.
* The need to have multiple build environments arises:

* When enterprises managing Bitbucket have multiple client enviroments
* Multiple testing phases or Elaborate git workflows used by customers
fields.summary: Provision to Increase Deployment Environments

fields.description:
The current implementation for flexible deployments in Pipelines allows us to define multiple Test, Staging and Production deployments However, all deployments in a specific phase (e.g. Production) have to be executed sequentially. In our case, we have multiple production deployments for multiple countries (Kenya, Tanzania and Nigeria). With the current setup, we are forced to deploy to all production deployments sequentially (only one ‘Deploy’ button is clickable).

We would like to propose a change in the UI, where the user can trigger any manual deployment for a specific phase. (e.g. we would like the ability to deploy to Production-Nigeria without having to deploy Production-Kenya first).
fields.summary: Support parallel deployments
API for large Diff returns Unable to respond in time

fields.description:
clicking the button would collapse the diff down to the header bar and the label of the button would toggle to: “Expand diff”.

‌

Currently for big diffs, you have to scroll all the way down and make sure

!2837568585-image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add option to collapse file diff

fields.description:
When a pull request is submitted and is code reviewed comments are added to modify the code. When the code is modified and pushed the comments disappear from the diff and instead one has to go to “Activity” tab to see them again.

A nice feature would be to have the option of keeping the comments visible even when the lines are changed. That way, the reviewer can review the code faster and make sure that what was commented corresponds with the new change.

As the PR author it is also useful when the comments are still there to make sure all comments are addressed. It even happened to me last year that a senior developer thought I’d hid a comment instead of addressing it, which gave me a good idea for the future ;)
fields.summary: Pull request comments get hidden after changes

fields.description:

Restarting command:
$ gcloud app deploy src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/appengine-web.xml --quiet
ERROR: (gcloud.app.deploy) To use the local staging for java, a Java 7+ JRE must be installed and on your system PATH
Deployment failed.

I manually examined the pipe’s Docker container and indeed it doesn't seem to have any Java installed:

{code}
docker run -i -t --entrypoint /bin/bash bitbucketpipelines/google-app-engine-deploy:0.3.1
bash-4.4# java -version
bash: java: command not found
{code}
fields.summary: App Engine deployment pipe fails to deploy Spring Boot app

fields.description: I have an abap repository, but when I want to perform a code search, the 100% search does not work for me. How can I make this work?
fields.summary: ABAP repository language

fields.description:
In current system, Bit bucket is integrated → Atlassian Cloud → Google Authentication.

But, once I create my account in bit bucket with new account alias and password, BB authentication is not asking for Google Auth any more.  Which is where it is breaking the authentication cycle.   Bit bucket login through app in code push / pull should redirect to Atlassian->Google auth way.  Am not referring the api keys way of authentication here.

Hope am able to explain in clear.
fields.summary: Login to account

fields.description:
To ease the work load on operations teams, bit bucket should provide certain more options on the repository tree level.

# Adding / removing an user manually to the repository permissions or repository level.
# Let us say @myprimarydomain.com  is my company domain, if any one adds external domain accounts to my repositories, BB should give an option to notify admins.

Above events should have an option to log under audit log and also send notifications to admin group ( if they select that option ).

In current scenario Bit bucket lacks this admin option feature of monitoring external domain users joining the repo’s.

Thanks,
fields.summary: Repository Operations - User Management

fields.description:
Audit log features provided by Bitbucket were not even basic and not sufficient for the operations guys to manage the account.

User Management Operations features that Bitbucket should provide to manage the account.

# Inviting new users
# Enabling and revoking site access to users
# User adding email alias to his account.
# Adding users to groups

Every event of above should trigger a notification to a group or admin group.
fields.summary: More Audit options for Operations teams
